means: 截断，缩短( curtail的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: His powers will be severely curtailed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的权力将受到极大的限制。

sentence.Network_en: Spending on books has been severely curtailed.
sentence.Network_cn: 购书开支已被大大削减。

sentence.Network_en: Their public health programme had to be severely curtailed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的公共卫生计划不得不大大收缩.

PerfectNetExp.abs: The outdoor ceremony was curtailed because of the storm ., 由于暴风雨 , 室外仪式的时间缩短了.
My speech was cut short ; Personal freedom is curtailed in many countries ., 我的演讲被减短了 ; 个人的自由在很多国家被缩减了.
illness has curtailed her sporting activities ., 她因病而减少了体育活动.
Its power curtailed , Hamas created its own force in Gaza ., 由于权力被削减 , 哈马斯在加沙建立起了自己的武装.

list.abs: investment cost 投资费用investment curtailment 缩减投资investment direction 投资方向
...【商务用语】curtail public spending 缩减公共支出curtailed inspection 抽样检查3.curve n.曲线
production crew 采油队production curtailment 限产production curve 产量曲线
in other words的翻译中文意思-在线英汉词典 ... count word 计数字 curtailed word 缩短词 data word 作数据的字.

entry.def: If you curtail something, you reduce or limit it.

example.ex: NATO plans to curtail the number of troops being sent to the region...
example.tran: 北约计划缩减派往该地区的士兵数量。

example.ex: I told Louie that old age would curtail her activities in time...
example.tran: 我告诉路易，一上年纪她的活动量就会减少。

auth_sentence.content: The company successfully curtailed its costs to boost margins.
auth_sentence.res_content: The company successfully curtailed its costs to boost margins.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The company successfully curtailed its costs to boost margins.

auth_sentence.content: The influence of Rupert Murdoch has been drastically curtailed.
auth_sentence.res_content: The influence of Rupert Murdoch has been drastically curtailed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The influence of Rupert Murdoch has been drastically curtailed.

auth_sentence.content: The climate change band wagon has curtailed real science.
auth_sentence.res_content: The climate change band wagon has curtailed real science.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The climate change band wagon has curtailed real science.
